channel.title: Stockwatch - Key Events
channel.description: Real-time corporate announcements, deals, and financial results.

item.title: [IOC] Indian Oil Corporation Ltd Announces Superannuation of Senior Management Personnel
item.description:
Indian Oil Corporation Ltd has announced the superannuation of two Senior Management personnel, Mr. Pitamber Tripathy, Executive Director I/c, Western Region Office, and Mr. Saurabh Dutt, Executive Director I/c (CC & Branding), Corporate Office, as per the Regulation 30 of SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations 2015. The superannuation will be effective from 28th February 2026.

  • Mr. Pitamber Tripathy, Executive Director I/c, Western Region Office, has superannuated from Indian Oil Corporation Ltd.
  • Mr. Saurabh Dutt, Executive Director I/c (CC & Branding), Corporate Office, has superannuated from Indian Oil Corporation Ltd.

ðŸ“„ Read Official Filing (PDF)


Company: INDIAN OIL CORPORATION LTD. | Category: Business Update

item.title: [KUMPFIN] Kumbhat Financial Services Ltd Appoints New Company Secretary and Compliance Officer
item.description:
Kumbhat Financial Services Ltd has announced the appointment of Shri Bharath Selva Ganesh P as the new Company Secretary and Compliance Officer, effective from March 01, 2026. Shri Mohan Raj S has ceased to hold the position from February 28, 2026. Shri Bharath Selva Ganesh P is a law graduate from Dr. Ambedkar Law University and a qualified Company Secretary. His employment terms and conditions will be as per the company's extant policy.

  • Shri Mohan Raj S ceases to be Company Secretary and Compliance Officer
  • Shri Bharath Selva Ganesh P appointed as new Company Secretary and Compliance Officer
  • Effective from March 01, 2026
  • Shri Bharath Selva Ganesh P is a law graduate and qualified Company Secretary
  • His terms and conditions of employment as per the company's policy

ðŸ“„ Read Official Filing (PDF)


Company: KUMBHAT FINANCIAL SERVICES LTD. | Category: Board Meeting

item.description:

item.title: [MADHAV] Madhav Marbles & Granites Ltd. to Consider Related Party Transactions on March 05, 2026
item.description:
Madhav Marbles & Granites Ltd. has informed the BSE that a meeting of the Board of Directors is scheduled on March 05, 2026. The Board will consider and approve the proposal for entering into Related Party Transactions with Madhav Surfaces FZC LLC, which is a Related Party. This information is provided by Priyanka Manawat, Company Secretary of Madhav Marbles & Granites Ltd.

  • Madhav Marbles & Granites Ltd. scheduled a Board Meeting on March 05, 2026
  • The Board will consider entering into Related Party Transactions with Madhav Surfaces FZC LLC
  • Madhav Surfaces FZC LLC is a Related Party of Madhav Marbles & Granites Ltd.
  • Priyanka Manawat, Company Secretary, provided the information

Company: MADHAV MARBLES & GRANITES LTD. | Category: Board Meeting

item.title: [ADFFOODS] General Manager â€” Supply Chain of Adf Foods Ltd Resigns for New Opportunities
item.description:
Adf Foods Ltd has announced the resignation of Mr. Jeetendra Joshi, General Manager â€” Supply Chain, who will be leaving the company effective from the closure of business hours on 28 February, 2026. The decision is made so that he can pursue new opportunities and challenges. The company assures that the supply chain operations will continue to run smoothly and remain unaffected by this change. There is no other material reason for the resignation other than the reason mentioned above.

  • Mr. Jeetendra Joshi, General Manager â€” Supply Chain, has resigned from Adf Foods Ltd.
  • He will be leaving the company on 28 February, 2026 to pursue new opportunities and challenges.
  • Adf Foods Ltd confirms that supply chain operations will not be affected by this change.
  • There is no other material reason for the resignation other than the reason mentioned above.

item.title: [POWERGRID] Power Grid Corporation Fined Rs. 5,42,800 Each by BSE and NSE for Non-Compliance with Board Composition Requirement
item.description:
Power Grid Corporation of India Ltd. has received notices from BSE Limited and National Stock Exchange of India Limited regarding non-compliance with the requirement related to composition of the Board (Regulation 17(1) of SEBI LODR) during the quarter ended 31st December, 2025. Both BSE and NSE have imposed a fine of Rs. 5,42,800 each, including GST, for such non-compliance. The company, being a Government Company, has taken up the matter with the Administrative Ministry i.e. Ministry of Power for filling up the vacant posts of Independent Directors. Power Grid Corporation has requested BSE & NSE to grant waiver of fine w.r.t. non-compliance with the Regulation 17(1) of the SEBI LODR.

  • Power Grid Corporation fined Rs. 5,42,800 each by BSE and NSE
  • Non-compliance with Regulation 17(1) of SEBI LODR
  • Relates to composition of the Board during the quarter ended 31st December, 2025
  • Power Grid Corporation is a Government Company within the meaning of Section 2(45) of the Companies Act, 2013
  • Company has requested BSE & NSE to grant waiver of fine w.r.t. non-compliance with the Regulation 17(1) of the SEBI LODR

ðŸ“„ Read Official Filing (PDF)


Company: POWER GRID CORPORATION OF INDIA LTD. | Category: Legal

item.title: [VASWANI] Vaswani Industries Ltd. Announces Q3 and Nine Months Results for 2025, Revealing Increased Revenue and Profit
item.description:
ðŸ”¥ Trending

Vaswani Industries Ltd. has announced its un-audited standalone financial results for the third quarter and nine months ended December 31, 2025. The company's revenue from operations has increased by 38.64% for the quarter and 42.35% for the nine months period, compared to the same periods in 2024. The profit before tax and exceptional items has also increased by 65.49% for the quarter and 45.58% for the nine months period. However, the profit for the period has decreased by 795.29 due to exceptional items and tax expense. The company's earnings per equity share (Par value Rs. 10 each) for the quarter are Rs. 0.24 (Basic) and Rs. 0.24 (Diluted). The financial results were reviewed by the Audit Committee and approved by the Board of Directors.

  • Revenue from operations increased by 38.64% for the quarter and 42.35% for the nine months period.
  • Profit before tax and exceptional items increased by 65.49% for the quarter and 45.58% for the nine months period.
  • Profit for the period decreased by 795.29 due to exceptional items and tax expense.
  • Earnings per equity share (Par value Rs. 10 each) for the quarter are Rs. 0.24 (Basic) and Rs. 0.24 (Diluted).
  • Financial results reviewed by the Audit Committee and approved by the Board of Directors.

ðŸ“„ Read Official Filing (PDF)


Company: VASWANI INDUSTRIES LTD. | Category: Quarterly Result

item.title: [PICTUREHS] Picturehouse Media Ltd: Independent Director, Mr. Gautam Shahi, Resigns
item.description:
Picturehouse Media Ltd announced the resignation of its Independent Director, Mr. Gautam Shahi, with effect from the close of business hours on 28th February 2026. The decision was due to a significant increase in Mr. Shahi's professional commitments in his legal practice, making it difficult for him to devote the required time and attention to his role as an Independent Director. Mr. Shahi confirmed that there are no other material reasons for his resignation.

  • Mr. Gautam Shahi resigns from his position as Independent Director of Picturehouse Media Ltd.
  • The resignation is effective from the close of business hours on 28th February 2026.
  • The decision is due to increased professional commitments in Mr. Shahi's legal practice.
  • Mr. Shahi confirms no other material reasons for his resignation.
  • Picturehouse Media Ltd complies with the applicable provisions of the SEBI (LODR) Regulations, 2015.

ðŸ“„ Read Official Filing (PDF)


Company: PICTUREHOUSE MEDIA LTD. | Category: Management Change

item.title: [KESAR] Kesar India Ltd Approves Allotment of 5,74,319 Equity Shares to Non-Promoters
item.description:
ðŸ”¥ Trending

Kesar India Ltd, in a meeting of the Preferential Issue Committee of the Board of Directors, approved the allotment of 5,74,319 equity shares to non-promoter allottees. The shares are being allotted pursuant to the conversion of 3,74,319 fully convertible warrants allotted on September 18, 2025, at an issue price of Rs. 350 each. The allottees include Gunjan Agarwal, Priyank Dhirendra Shah, Mohit Rajeshkumar Atlani, Mihir Atlani, Yash Suresh Atlani, Prachi Pranav Bhagat, Chintan Viijay Makhecha, Dhavan Govindram Medtiya, and Piyush Narayanlal Medtiya. The paid-up equity share capital of the company will increase to Rs. 28,57,32,290 divided into 2,85,73,229 equity shares of face value of Rs. 10 each.

  • Kesar India Ltd approves allotment of 5,74,319 equity shares to non-promoter allottees.
  • The allotment is pursuant to the conversion of 3,74,319 fully convertible warrants allotted on September 18, 2025.
  • The allottees include Gunjan Agarwal, Priyank Dhirendra Shah, Mohit Rajeshkumar Atlani, Mihir Atlani, Yash Suresh Atlani, Prachi Pranav Bhagat, Chintan Viijay Makhecha, Dhavan Govindram Medtiya, and Piyush Narayanlal Medtiya.
  • The paid-up equity share capital of the company will increase to Rs. 28,57,32,290 divided into 2,85,73,229 equity shares of face value of Rs. 10 each.
  • The meeting of the Preferential Issue Committee of the Board of Directors was commenced at 07:45 P.M. and concluded at 08:00 P.M.

ðŸ“„ Read Official Filing (PDF)


Company: Kesar India Ltd | Category: Quarterly Updates

item.title: [PVP] Independent Director, Mr. Gautam Shahi, Resigns from PVP Ventures Ltd
item.description:
PVP Ventures Ltd announced the resignation of its Independent Director, Mr. Gautam Shahi, with effect from the close of business hours on 28th February 2026. The decision was due to a significant increase in Mr. Shahi's professional commitments in his legal practice, making it difficult for him to devote the required time and attention to his role as an Independent Director. Mr. Shahi confirmed that there are no other material reasons for his resignation.

  • The resignation is effective from the close of business hours on 28th February 2026
  • The decision is due to increased professional commitments in Mr. Shahi's legal practice
  • Mr. Shahi confirmed that there are no other material reasons for his resignation
